channel.title: Annotated on juri.strumpflohner
channel.description: Recent content in Annotated on juri.strumpflohner

item.title: Droidcon London 2011 - Europe's largest Android Conference
item.description: Droidcon London 2011 is Europe's largest conference that exclusively covers Android development and applications. The conference will take place in London on 6th-7th October 2011.

item.title: Test-Driven Development and Automated Testing: A Metaphor
item.description: Motivation is an important factor when learning something new. It is what makes you ambitious and what helps you forget the effort that needs to be invested.

item.title: Presentation: Dropbox Startup Lessons Learned
item.description: An interesting presentation by the Dropbox founder Drew Houston about Dropbox startup lessons learned. Also if you don't plan to create any startup it is still interesting to see some of the strategies that have been applied and which finally made Dropbox as successful as it is - in a market which btw already seemed to be saturated.

item.title: Tired to Manually Enter Wifi Network Configurations into your Android Phone??
item.description: Today a rather non-programming-related blog post :) . You probably encountered already the issue of configuring your Wifi access to your home or work wireless system.

item.title: Retrieve Selected Items on Checkable ListView: Differences in SDK Level 7 and 8
item.description: I'm currently testing my Android app that I'm developing for my MSc thesis on different real devices. While I own a Nexus One with Android Froyo 2.

item.title: TDD Test == Unit Test or TDD Test <> Unit Test?? Is it Really Important??
item.description: Recently I had an interesting buzz conversation with a former work-mate, Peter. Just like myself he heavily orientates his learning to best practices, especially into agile software development methodologies and automated testing.

item.title: The World of ListView
item.description: I just watched Roman Guy's and Adam Powell's (two Android UI framework engineers) talk about the "World of ListView". They gave the presentation on this year's Google I/O event in May.

item.title: Every Developer Needs a Blog!
item.description: I just watched an interesting talk from Channel 9 held by Scott Hanselman. His message: "Every developer needs a blog". As you can imagine it is a rather non-technical talk, but still interesting cause he emphasizes the importance of being "

item.title: Testing Newbies: Some Thoughts about Test First
item.description: A quick post just before diving into the weekend filled with Yoseikan training, swimming, going out with friends and - of course - Android coding :) .

item.title: I am ready to write some unit tests. What code coverage should I aim for?
item.description: Here's a nice "story" about code coverage from the Google Testing Blog. Testivus on Test Coverage Early one morning, a young programmer asked the great master:

item.title: Exercising Our Remote Application Removal Feature
item.description: A friend of mine shared an interesting blog entry from the Android Developer Blog on Buzz. Here some excerpts: Exercising Our Remote Application Removal Feature

item.title: Let tests guide you through development
item.description: I'm currently working on my MSc thesis work which is divided into a project that has to be developed (in my case an Android application) and then the according paper that has to be written.

item.title: Preview the new Gmail web interface for the iPad in Chrome
item.description: Since the launch of the iPhone and later the Android mobile OS, Google has investigated some time in creating more mobile friendly interfaces of their common web applications (Gmail, GReader, GDocs,Wave), optimized for the advanced touch interfaces.

item.title: Tune your emulator with a pretty Nexus One skin!
item.description: I know it doesn't really increase your value during development. It's just for fun but those of you that like it, here are some links that point to Nexus One skins that can be used on your local dev emulator.

item.title: That's what I'm missing in Visual Studio! Give me better code editor support!!
item.description: Visual Studio is great in doing many things as for instance in integrating with other MS products (obviously) or with debugging. The VS debugger is one of the best I've seen till now (using different IDEs).

item.title: Android SMS activity doesn't fill phone number
item.description: Today while fixing a bug for our current project we develop for the Android phone I found a strange behavior when trying to launch the phone's SMS sender activity.

item.title: Instantiating object from generic type: Java vs. .Net
Repeater looses its data collection. ViewState problem?
item.description: A while back I experienced a really strange problem in one of our ASP.net applications, namely my repeater control which was loosing its data collection after a postback to the server.

item.title: Are C# regions a good thing??
item.description: Well, I'd say it depends. If you use regions to logically group your code in your class, then it may be a good thing 'cause people come to your class and see something like

item.title: What is a browser?
item.description: Do you know the answer? I'm pretty sure (> 90% of the blog readers here have a technical background). But check out this video to get a feeling of how non-technical users view the world of browsers, search engines and the Internet.

item.title: Did you know the "Joel Test"?
item.description: First of all, who is "Joel"? Joel Spolsky is a software developer in the US. I came across his interesting blog about a year ago.

item.title: Image search: Bing vs. Google Image
item.description: Bing does a great job in displaying images. You get all of them displayed in the center of the page within a separate scrollable container.

item.title: Google Wave - Collaboration et excellence
item.description: Some days ago I just quickly scrolled over my Google Reader friends' items and saw Manfred's blog entry about Google Wave. It kept my attention since I didn't yet hear anything about that new Google product.

item.title: Will Microsoft's Bing become Google's biggest threat?
item.description: Microsoft Live Search release wasn't a big success to compete Google on the search engine market. Now they're about to release Bing which is isn't thought to be another "

item.title: Dropbox - Sharing, synching and backup has never been so easy
item.description: I wanted to write this post already for a longer time, actually I had it (between my other approx. 30 not yet finished posts) in the draft folder.

item.title: Microsoft Surface...the future of human-computer interaction?
item.description:
Here are some videos about Microsoft Surface. I wonder how long it will take to see one of these live :)
(bad audio quality)

item.title: The competition is open: Safari 4 vs. Chrome
item.description: No, joke :) . But did you check out the new Safari 4? Ehm...seems as if the guys at Apple have taken a quite deep look at the Chrome source code and then they suddenly came up with great new ideas :D And.
